I have:
- Pair of Aces (Ace of Spades, Ace of Diamonds)
- Pair of Kings (King of Spades Steel Card, King of Diamonds)

Let me calculate the best option:

**Option 1: Flush with 4 spades (need 5 for flush, so this won't work)**


**Option 2: Two Pair (Aces and Kings)**

To form two pair, I need to play both the Aces and Kings together. If I play Ace of Spades, Ace of Diamonds, King of Diamonds, and a fourth card, I get a pair of Aces worth 32 chips base. But I should consider whether playing both pairs gives me better value with my Jokers, particularly Sock and Buskin which retriggers face cards and Wrathful Joker which rewards spades.

**Option 3: Playing all four face cards**

If I commit both Kings and both Aces to Two Pair, I sacrifice the Steel King's X1.5 multiplier. The hand scores 62 chips base (20 for two pair plus the card values), and with Wrathful Joker adding +3 per spade, Abstract Joker's +15 mult, and Sock and Buskin retriggering all four face cards, the multiplier compounds significantly. I need to weigh whether this setup outperforms keeping the Steel King held for its multiplier bonus. 3, King of Spades +3, and they each score twice, so +12 total. Mult comes to 2 (base) + 12 (wrathful) + 15 (abstract) = 29 mult, giving me 104 × 29 = 3,016 chips.

That exceeds 3000, but I should double-check this. Actually, Steel King requires staying in hand to get the X1.5 mult bonus—if I play it, that multiplier disappears. So I need to reconsider whether keeping it unplayed while using the other cards for Three of a Kind might work better.

With 4 spades, I can't make a Flush, so I'm weighing whether Steel King's X1.5 mult in hand outweighs playing it as part of a stronger combination. If I keep it and play a pair of Aces instead, I get 32 chips from the pair, base mult of 2, plus the Wrathful and Abstract bonuses, with Sock and Buskin retriggering the Aces for additional scoring.

That gives me 54 chips × 30 mult = 1,620 total, which falls short. Let me evaluate the Two Pair hand more carefully by playing all four cards—both Aces and both Kings. The base is 20 chips, and scoring left to right: Ace of Spades adds 11 chips and triggers Wrathful for +3 mult, then gets retriggered by Sock and Buskin. King of Spades contributes 10 chips with another Wrathful trigger and retrigger. Ace of Diamonds adds 11 chips with a retrigger, followed by King of Diamonds.

The second King adds 10 chips with a retrigger, bringing total chips to 104. Multiplier comes to 29 from the base 2, plus 12 from Wrathful activations across both spades cards, plus 15 from Abstract. That's 104 × 29 = 3,016 chips, which works. I'll go with positions 1, 2, 6, 7 for the Two Pair.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
